column4: Lint but I need the newest version.    sudo apt-get update xchat doesn't work
is it buggy for you ?
why do you "need" the newest version ?
somebody said 2.8.6 is buggy
I'm saying it's "not buggy" does that make it "ok" to use now ?
i dont want to show messages in xchat when somebody is connected. and i don't know how to switch this off.
ok - you don't need to upgrade for that
thanks
that's just a setting, someone in #xchat can tell you how to do that
don't download packages from packages.debian.org
unless you have a real reason to upgrade xchat - don't
can you tell me? the right-click doesn't work
you can disable join messages quite easy in the current version
i have a german menu here :/
I don't know the german menu
and in the english?
I don't have xchat on this machine, someone in #xchat can tell you very easy
/join #xchat and ask "how do I disable join/part messages in xchat" and they will tell you
i thougt this here is #xchat. sorry
this is #ubuntu
look at cpufreq-applet and evince-thumbnail they are eating ram, I bet they are locking cpu, rather than using it
